snippet.title: Q: Technologies and standards in a Kindle

Since I'm not an expert in all the technologies used, can those aware of them point them out … . For example: the GUI is programmed in embedded Java (which is probably a bad choice) Whispernet is used for the wireless platform What are the libraries or underlying technologies …

snippet.title: Q: Using CookieManager in Kindle
snippet.description: to successfully use cookies in native code on some Android devices (Android 4.3 and 4.4) by using CookieManager. However, I got an empty cookie list on my Kindle 3rd generation (Android 4.2.2). What's the right way to share cookies between WebViews and native code when using Kindle devices? Thanks, … I'd like to use cookies set in WebView in native code. By following instructions described in here (http://blog.winfieldpeterson.com/2013/01/17/cookies-in-hybrid-android-apps/) I was able …

snippet.title: Q: kindle vs android
snippet.description: I develop application for android and kindle. I want to use one layout for two devices, is that possible or I should provide layout for android and kindle separately? snippet.title: Q: Webview browser in Kindle Fire
snippet.description: Is the webview browser used in Kindle Fire the same as in ordinary Android webview? If not, what are the differences? Specifically, I'm interested in performance issues or quirks you have to be aware … of when adapting web apps for Kindle Fire. Amazon won't send any Kindle Fires to Sweden, so I can't test it myself - yet. …
